text: Léon-Alfred Opimbat (born 1950?Roger Ngombé, "Gouvernement : biographie des trois nouveaux ministres", Les Dépêches de Brazzaville, 20 August 2011 . ) is a Congolese politician. He served in the government of Congo-Brazzaville as Minister of Health from 1992 to 1993 and as Minister of National Solidarity and Humanitarian Action from 1997 to 2002, with additional responsibility for the health portfolio beginning in 1999. Subsequently, he was a Deputy in the National Assembly from 2002 to 2007 and again from 2007 to 2011. ==References== Category:1950s births Category:Living people Category:Republic of the Congo politicians Category:Government ministers
title: Léon-Alfred Opimbat
